	with ESMTP id JdoFm7Rk6Ox4 for <submit@bugs.debian.org>;
	Tue,  8 Apr 2008 14:07:01 +0200 (CEST)
Received: from chiisai.kerker.die-welt.net (ip-62-143-60-10.1411O-CUD12K-03.ish.de [62.143.60.10])
	by atuin.die-welt.net (Postfix) with ESMTP id 0C8671778F7
	for <submit@bugs.debian.org>; Tue,  8 Apr 2008 14:07:01 +0200 (CEST)
Date: Tue, 8 Apr 2008 14:07:00 +0200
From: Evgeni Golov <sargentd@die-welt.net>
To: submit@bugs.debian.org
Subject: bluez-gnome: please add XFCE to bluetooth-applet.desktop
X-Mailer: Sylpheed 2.5.0beta1 (GTK+ 2.12.9; i486-pc-linux-gnu)
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Message-Id: <20080408120701.0C8671778F7@atuin.die-welt.net>
Delivered-To: submit@bugs.debian.org

Package: bluez-gnome
Version: 0.22-1
Severity: wishlist

In /etc/xdg/autostart/bluetooth-applet.desktop "OnlyShowIn=GNOME" is
set, which prevents the bluetooth-applet to autostart in Xfce.
Modifying the line to
OnlyShowIn=GNOME;XFCE;
does the trick and bluetooth-applet starts fine in my Xfce (and works
off course).
Please modify the line in the Debian package, so Xfce users don't need
to start bluetooth-applet by hand.

Regards
Evgeni Golov



------------=_1208705613-29786-0

Content-Disposition: inline

attached.

have further comments please address them to 475003@bugs.debian.org,
and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.

Debian distribution maintenance software

Filippo Giunchedi <filippo@debian.org> (supplier of updated bluez-gnome p=
